articles.description: Step-by-step guide to creating high-performance 3D scroll effects with GSAP, ScrollTrigger, and CSS transform techniques.

articles.title: How To Leverage Component Variants In Penpot

articles.description: Unlock the power of component variants and design tokens in Penpot to build flexible, scalable design systems with reusable components and adaptable styles.

articles.title: Explaining the Accessible Benefits of Using Semantic HTML Elements
articles.author: CSS-Tricks
articles.description: Understand how semantic <button> elements enhance accessibility, providing better support for assistive technologies compared to generic <div> tags.

articles.title: The “Most Hated” CSS Feature: tan()

articles.title: FedCM updates: Display iframe domain

articles.title: The Weird Parts of position: sticky;

description: Explore the art of creating dynamic animations and transitions in web development. Delve into 3D animations with Spline's Timeline feature, high-performance scroll effects using GSAP and CSS, and the innovative View Transition API. Understand the power of CSS sibling-index() for staggered animations and the role of semantic HTML in enhancing accessibility. Also, tackle the ongoing debate around CSS's tan() function and discover how to harness Penpot's design tokens for scalable design systems.
joke: Why did the frontend developer go broke? Because they kept using 'position: absolute;' for everything!
challenge: Create a mini interactive art gallery using HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. Incorporate WebGL or Canvas to allow users to 'walk' through the gallery and explore 3D artwork with smooth transitions. Optionally, use the View Transition API to animate between different gallery rooms or exhibits, and implement a responsive layout that adapts to different screen sizes.
